title: I really do like base R plotting
description: A short description of the post.
contents:
I have to admit, I really do like building plots with classic, base R functions.
First, you don’t have to build a dataframe, but it inot tidy format, or whatever. Make some vectors and BAM! You’re done.
Here’s some data from a classic study of deer in the George Reserve in Michigan.
Type it in and done.

title: Old-school error bars in base R using Hmisc::errbar()
description: A short description of the post.
contents:
Data taken from Table 1 of Barnes et al. 1994.



References
Barnes, Barnes and Kapela. 1994. The long-term impact of elephant browsing on baobab trees at Msembe, Ruaha National Park, Tanzania. African Journal of Ecology 32: 177-184 https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1365-2028.1994.tb00569.x

title: Overlaying a barplot with a line graph in base R
description: A short description of the post.
contents:
Data extracted from Figure 4 of Foley and Faust (2010) using metaDigitise.
[Foley and Faust 2010](https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/oryx/article/rapid-population-growth-in-an-elephant-loxodonta-africana-population-recovering-from-poaching-in-tarangire-national-park-tanzania/2DADFFCB562E9553B1DF7688EB372FBF. Rapid population growth in an elephant Loxodonta africana population recovering from poaching in Tarangire National Park, Tanzania. Oryx 44:205 - 212. https://doi.org/10.1017/S0030605309990706
“Poaching virtually ceased in the Park following the 1989 ivory ban and during the study there were no known poaching incidents in the northern subpopulation.”

title: Scatterplot case study: Ecological succession in Mexico
description: A short description of the post.
contents:
Data were extracted from Figure 2a of Lebrija-Trejos et al. (2008) using metaDigitise.

(Intercept)        Year 
 17.2543498   0.8344402 


References
Lebrija-Trejos et al. Successional Change and Resilience of a Very Dry Tropical Deciduous Forest Following Shifting Agriculture. Biotropica 40: 422–431. 10.1111/j.1744-7429.2008.00398.x.

title: Welcome to Computational Biology for All!
description:
Welcome to our new blog, Computational Biology for All!. We hope you enjoy 
reading what we have to say!
